cards.description: Yes, yes! More! Oh, is that all you have? But I was so enjoying myself. If that's all the fun you can offer, I'll just have to kill you.

cards.description: We are guardians of the dead in the service of Nephthys, goddess of Amenta. We bring death to those who disturb the sleep of the departed, and send them to the underworld.
cards.evo_description: Vile grave-robbers, you've blasphemed against the dead, so your fates are sealed! Prepare to be judged by the goddess of Amenta!

cards.evo_description: The nethergod returned him to life as a headless horseman, and he sped away into the dark. So it falls upon us to prepare for the next war, when he will surely haunt us again. —Chapter 19, Notes on Gods and Demons

cards.description: Do you have business with a mad hatter? I brought one man's hat right with me, but nothing for young ladies unfortunately.
cards.evo_description: Days like these are the best, miss. That's doubly true for the world you're from! Just give it some thought. You don't want to make any regrets.

cards.description: Lands of wonders, lands of marvels! Anything you wish for will come true! I was born because that's what you wished for, Alice.
cards.evo_description: If the world changes, I'll have to change too. Isn't that scary to think about? I don't want the world to change, and I don't want to change either. So I'm going to stay an illusion.

cards.description: A cage of life or perhaps a literal living hell, this undying armor harbors tens of thousands of souls. It is a supernatural being that extends its life by feeding on death. —Demonic Recollections, Chapter 6
cards.evo_description: It shines with animus; it radiates malice. Behind its breastplate, indignation melds with despair as souls swirl in a stygian eddy that surpasses the pits of hell. —Demonic Recollections, Chapter 7

cards.evo_description: The guardian of the scales dons the mask of a beast, never erring in judgment. Today, the scale shifts the feather of truth towards the heavens once again.

cards.evo_description: Oh, I'm sorry. He was just so charming that I had to make him my own. But see! Don't you think he looks better with me?

cards.evo_description: Shrouded away in a mist of souls, it cannot be seen. Is it only one? Are there two or more? When it finally springs into action, the world may well end.

cards.evo_description: Games are only fun for the victor! Losing's not worth a thing whether you're trounced or knicked. That's why I'll win and keep winning.

cards.evo_description: There's no way he would betray me. What good would it do him? I won't let him run, I won't let him go, and I won't let him off. Haha—he's going to have to take responsibility.

cards.description: Where others take days to create a world, this dragon takes just an instant.
cards.evo_description: In order to create, one need only entrust their soul to the sea. In order to destroy, one need only summon a whirlpool to swallow the land. Everything comes from water, and one day everything will return there.

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare: Banish all cards that cost 7 play points or less from your deck.
cards.org_skill_disc: [b]Fanfare[/b][b]:[/b] Banish all cards that cost 7 play points or less from your deck.
cards.description: The divine floods washed away every destiny, but from the mud rose a call. In that moment all incidence became inevitability. —Cyclical Histories, Chapter 2
cards.evo_description: The oracle that emerged from the mud will carry in its body everything from this world's beginning and end. Radiant, it will spin the fate of the world—creating all, destroying all. —Cyclical Histories, Chapter 5

cards.description: A depraved creature of evil, wickedness incarnate—from its mouths it expels one thousand curses and one million poisons. —Terrors of the World, Chapter 4
cards.evo_description: It is not blood, but venom that flows in its veins—not life, but malice inside its body. The three necked dark dragon is truly a terrible force not to be trifled with. —Terrors of the World, Chapter 4

cards.skill_disc: If you've played at least 10 other non-follower cards this match, and you have 10 play points, Choose: Play this card as a Virtuous Lindworm or an Iniquitous Lindworm.
cards.org_skill_disc: If you've played at least 10 other non-follower cards this match, and you have 10 play points, [b]Choose[/b][b]:[/b] Play this card as a [b]Virtuous Lindworm[/b] or an [b]Iniquitous Lindworm[/b].
cards.description: A blaze of light and the heavens are torn asunder. What will rain down from them: a merciful verdict of light or a merciless tyranny of dark?
cards.evo_description: A blaze of light and the heavens are covered. Will the creature bring forth the beginning of salvation or the end of sin?

cards.skill_disc: At the end of your turn, restore 5 defense to your leader. Then draw 5 cards.
cards.org_skill_disc: At the end of your turn, restore 5 defense to your leader. Then draw 5 cards.
cards.evo_skill_disc: (Same as the unevolved form.)
cards.org_evo_skill_disc: (Same as the unevolved form.)
cards.description: As the heavens are torn asunder, the dark clouds dissipate. The light of judgment reigns, and a merciful verdict is set forth.
cards.evo_description: White lightning tears across the sky, raining salvation onto all in existence. Ah, but do not fear. Bow your head and accept it.

cards.description: From beneath the heavens, dark clouds gather. The tyrannies of darkness reign, and a merciless verdict is set forth.
cards.evo_description: Black lightning tears across the sky, raining finality onto all in existence. Ah, but do not fear. Bow your head and accept it.

cards.description: I appear when the balance of the world comes under threat. Come. Join me in the fight.
cards.evo_description: You've shown me just what wonders your world has to offer. However... I need not mention what I will do to you should you ever threaten it.

cards.org_evo_skill_disc: [b]Last Words[/b][b]:[/b] Summon an unevolved [b]Mordecai, Eternal Duelist[/b].
cards.description: The oath and flames were once separated by death. No tears to douse the flame, no method to deliver the oath. A wandering blade teaches for eternity, seeking an immortal enemy. Once again, his duel begins.
cards.evo_description: If this were a story, it would have already reached the ending. If this were a song, the performance would have finished. However, this is his life—a reality that continues without end. And once again, his duel begins.

cards.description: After abducting the bodies of the living, he transfigures them completely. Assembled are instruments of resentment to perform malicious symphonies for his orchestra of slaughter.
cards.evo_description: The tones are striking and coarse—too intense for a human to endure. His otherworldly music twists the ears and crumples the heart. Upon the finale is an ovation from demonkind, as all that remains is death and destruction.
